Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that COVID-19 is caused by a novel coronavirus, not a bacteria.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the effectiveness of aspirin in treating COVID-19.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is based on a misinterpretation of a preliminary and unpublished research paper.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that there is a global conspiracy and that the World Health Organization mandated a ban on COVID-19 autopsies.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim ignores the alternative explanation that COVID-19 is caused by a virus, not a bacteria.
